code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: shows thrombi occluding right common femoral and popliteal veins

observation.value: shows thrombi occluding right common femoral and popliteal veins

td.content: s:patient presents with 3 years history of mild sudden onset of chest pain. patient is a 61 yr old white M. denies any alcohol use he denies smoking o:Height 181 cm, Weight 84.7 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 16 a:Deep Venous Thrombosis p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed warfarin - 5 mg daily, and ordered D-dimer, PT, PTT.

content2.Unmatched: denies any alcohol use he denies

td.content: s:62 yr old male presents with moderate pain and swelling in left shoulder, moderate denial of any past history of surgery and intravenous drug use and moderate swelling and mild numbness of the left arm for 4 days. he has a history of Deep Venous Thrombosis for past 2 years. o:Height 180 cm, Weight 84.2 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 75, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16 a:Deep Venous Thrombosis p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed fondaparinux - 10 mg daily, and ordered Doppler US of leg.
